organizations.name: A²MEND
organizations.description: Reedley’s chapter of the African American Male Education Network & Development mentors and empowers Black men on campus through academic support, leadership training, and community‑building activities.

organizations.name: Active Minds
organizations.description: A mental‑health advocacy group that hosts awareness events and peer‑to‑peer programs to help students prioritize wellness and end stigma.

organizations.name: Aeronautics Club
organizations.description: Brings together aviation enthusiasts for hands‑on projects, field trips, and networking with industry professionals.

organizations.name: Aggie Club
organizations.description: Unites agriculture majors and supporters for career exploration, community service, and social events tied to farming and agribusiness.

organizations.name: Alpha Gamma Sigma Honors
organizations.description: The Alpha Omega chapter of California’s community‑college honor society; members perform service projects and earn graduation honors cords.

organizations.name: American Sign Language Club
organizations.description: Provides a friendly space to practice ASL, learn about Deaf culture, and promote campus accessibility.

organizations.name: Associated Student Government
organizations.description: The official student voice in campus governance, ASG advocates for peers, sits on college committees, and sponsors events that enhance campus life.

organizations.name: Choir Club
organizations.description: Supports vocalists through extra rehearsals, performances, and outreach concerts connected to the Reedley College Concert Choir.

organizations.name: Art Club
organizations.description: Fosters creative exploration with studio workshops, gallery visits, and collaborative art projects open to all skill levels.

organizations.name: Collegiate Entrepreneurs Organization
organizations.description: Gives aspiring entrepreneurs a forum to network, hear guest speakers, and develop real‑world business ideas.

organizations.name: Dance Club
organizations.description: Celebrates movement by teaching diverse dance styles, staging performances, and promoting physical wellness through the arts.

organizations.name: Dream Team
organizations.description: A disability‑advocacy group whose motto “Taking the ‘DIS’ out of disability” raises awareness and removes stigma while building community among students with disabilities.

organizations.name: Early Childhood Education Club
organizations.description: Connects future teachers with professional‑development workshops, service projects, and networking in early‑learning settings.

organizations.name: Reedley College CRU
organizations.description: A Christian campus ministry that offers Bible studies, mentorship, and conferences to help students grow spiritually.

organizations.name: Forestry Club
organizations.description: Engages students interested in natural‑resource management through field trips, stewardship projects, and skills workshops.

organizations.name: Mule Club
organizations.description: Promotes hands‑on livestock and animal‑science experience—particularly with draft mules—via clinics, shows, and community outreach.

organizations.name: Pickleball Club
organizations.description: Organizes friendly games and tournaments of the fast‑growing paddle sport to encourage fitness and camaraderie.

organizations.name: Safe Space Club
organizations.description: Provides an inclusive lounge and advocates for LGBTQIA+ and other marginalized students through education, celebration, and peer support.

organizations.name: Science/Technology/Engineering/Math Club
organizations.description: Hosts hands‑on experiments, guest speakers, and field trips that spark curiosity across all STEM disciplines.

organizations.name: The Reedley College Theatre Society
organizations.description: Increases campus and community arts awareness by mounting student‑run theatrical productions each year.

organizations.name: Tech ++
organizations.description: A coding and technology‑innovation club that lets students collaborate on software or hardware projects and stay current with industry trends.

organizations.name: Ultimate Frisbee Club
organizations.description: Encourages active recreation and team spirit through regular pick‑up matches and intramural Ultimate tournaments.

organizations.name: Veterans Club
organizations.description: Builds a support network for military veterans and their families, offering camaraderie, resources, and advocacy on campus.

organizations.name: Anime Club
organizations.description: Brings fans of Japanese animation and manga together for screenings, discussions, and creative cosplay events.

organizations.name: Astrophotography Club
organizations.description: Trains members to capture and process images of celestial objects using telescopes and imaging software, while fostering a stargazing community.

organizations.name: Chess Club
organizations.description: Provides casual play, strategy workshops, and ladder competitions for players of all abilities.

organizations.name: Criminology Club
organizations.description: Explores criminal‑justice careers and current issues through guest speakers, facility tours, and community‑service projects.

organizations.name: Hiking Club
organizations.description: Plans local and regional hikes that promote outdoor fitness, environmental stewardship, and social connection.

organizations.name: Latino Student Association
organizations.description: Celebrates Latinx heritage, supports cultural events, and advocates for resources that help Latinx students succeed.

organizations.name: Lemon Club
organizations.description: Focuses on acts of kindness and positivity—“making lemonade out of lemons”—through volunteer service and campus morale‑boosting activities.

organizations.name: Technology Development Club
organizations.description: Gives future engineers and makers a space to prototype devices, learn new tools, and compete in design challenges.

events.description: The Board of Trustees of the State Center Community College District are elected by the voting public and represent seven geographic areas. The Board traditionally holds its monthly meetings on the first Tuesday of each month beginning at 3:30 p.m., unless otherwise noted. Meeting takes place at the District Board Room at 1171 Fulton Street in Fresno California, unless otherwise noted.
